articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris will sit down, separately, with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday, for high stakes talks on winding down the Gaza conflict.
articles.title: Biden, Harris to meet Netanyahu separately on Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ahmed Mohamed Hassan
articles.description: Israel is seeking changes to a plan for a Gaza truce and the release of hostages by Hamas, complicating a final deal to halt nine months of combat that have devastated the enclave, according to a Western official and a Palestinian and two Egyptian sources.
articles.title: Exclusive: Israel seeks changes to Gaza truce plan, complicating talks, sources say

articles.author: Drazen Jorgic
articles.description: Mexican drug lord Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada and the son of his former partner, Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, were arrested in El Paso, Texas, on Thursday, the U.S. Justice Department said.
articles.title: US arrests Mexican drug lord 'El Mayo' and El Chapo's son in Texas

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris took her presidential campaign blitz to the largest U.S. teachers' union on Thursday, promising a "fight for the future" as new opinion polls showed her narrowing the gap with Republican rival Donald Trump.
articles.title: Harris gains ground in polls as Trump tries to brand her a Marxist

articles.author: James Pearson
articles.description: North Korean hackers have conducted a global cyber espionage campaign to try to steal classified military secrets to support Pyongyang's banned nuclear weapons programme, the United States, Britain and South Korea said in a joint advisory on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korean hackers are stealing military secrets, say U.S. and allies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Gaemi blew through northern Taiwan on Thursday, killing two people, bringing floods and leading to traffic snarls, before heading across the sea and into China where it is expected to bring further torrential rain.
articles.title: Typhoon Gaemi barrels through Taiwan, killing two, heads to Chinese coast

articles.author: Uditha Jayasinghe
articles.description: Sri Lanka will vote on Sept. 21 to elect a new president, a government notice said on Friday, a crucial contest that is expected to determine the future of reforms in the South Asian island nation weathering its worst financial crisis in decades.
articles.title: Sri Lanka to hold presidential election on Sept 21, govt notice says

articles.author: David Ljunggren, Nia Williams
articles.description: A raging wildfire has devastated the western Canadian tourist town of Jasper, potentially destroying up to 50% of structures, and firefighters were working on Thursday to save as many buildings as possible, authorities said.
articles.title: Devastating wildfire burns down part of western Canadian tourist town

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: The U.S. military is building infrastructure in northern Australia to help it project power into the South China Sea if a crisis with China erupts, a Reuters review of documents and interviews with U.S. and Australian defence officials show.
articles.title: US military, seeking strategic advantages, builds up Australia's northern bases amid China tensions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket has been cleared to return to space by the U.S. aviation regulator after it was grounded by a rare mid-flight failure, the Federal Aviation administration (FAA) said on Thursday.
articles.title: SpaceX's Falcon 9 cleared to return to space, FAA says
